intro: Gnaphalium proteiforme, commonly known as the variable hairweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine, silky hairs, contributing to its common name.
